comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Street sign in center indicates this as the intersection of Madison Avenue with E 50th Street. In the Historical American Buildings Survey, this is listed as Villard Houses, 451-457 Madison Avenue & 24 East Fifty-first Street, New York, New York County, NY. See memory.loc.gov/cgi-bin/query/r?pp/hh:@field(DOCID+@lit(NY....

comment.author: 84264049@N00
comment._content: Now part of the vulgar New York Palace Hotel.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Hi swang: thanks for pointing out the address in the Historical American Buildings Survey (HABS) record.  It does look like the address in the HABS record is incorrect.  It should say 451-457 Madison Avenue.   Henry Villard erected these houses hence the name Villard Houses.  Whitelaw Reid was one of its residents.

comment.author: 12104215@N03
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called American /Italian Renaissance Architecture, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Whitelaw Reid (October 27, 1837 – December 15, 1912) was a U.S. politician and newspaper editor, as well as the author of a popular history of Ohio in the Civil War. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whitelaw_Reid
